p: The ability of making antibodies, also exploiting cross-reactive memory responses, could be a double-edged sword. Cross-reactive antibodies are not always beneficial, and in some cases they can do harm by enhancing inflammatory immune responses and viral entry into cells [ 113, 114]. However, even antibodies mediating viral infection can be protective in certain circumstances [ 115]. Even if the production of antibodies undergoes significant changes with ageing, there is not any proof that these changes are related to the higher severity of Covid-19 in the elderly.
